snippet: An appeal to the Vatican requires a copy of the formal decree ordering the closing, which the archdiocese refused to give out for months. They later called it an “oversight.”
abstract: Parishoners at Catholic churches across New York State merged or closed by Cardinal Timothy M Dolan express bewilderment at byzantine system of limitations imposed on obtaining or viewing decrees; those affected accuse officials of secrecy and attempting to limit churches' ability to appeal; archdiocese posts decrees on website after New York Times inquiry into matter, claiming oversight.
lead_paragraph: An appeal to the Vatican requires a copy of the formal decree ordering the closing, which the archdiocese refused to give out for months. They later called it an “oversight.”

headline.main: New York Archdiocese Parishioners See System of Secrets as They Fight Church Closings
headline.print_headline: Parishioners See a System of Secrets
